text: uber is facing a major shake-up after an
independent investigation into the
company's troubled culture the crisis
ballooned in February when a former
employee wrote a blog post alleging
sexual harassment and a lack of response
from the management the subsequent
investigation led by Eric Holder found
that executives had turned a blind eye
to corporate misbehavior here are a few
of the controversies that led to the
dismantling of ubers 18 Eric Alexander a
top executive in Asia was fired in early
June for mishandling the rape case of an
uber passenger in India in 2014
Alexander obtained the medical records
of the victim to conduct his own
investigation after the company was
banned from Delhi
uber executives were suspicious the rape
charges were part of a plan hatched by a
competitor according to people familiar
with the case Emil Michael
boobers second-in-command left the
company this week after a series of
controversies during his tenure in 2014
Michael made comments about doing
research to smear journalists who were
critical of the company CEO Travis
kalanick
Michael and Alexander were reported to
Human Resources in 2014 for visiting an
escort bar in South Korea while on a
business trip Palahniuk voluntarily
agreed to take a leave of absence from
uber to allow for a shift in company
culture the CEO was known for
aggressively ignoring rules and
regulations to help his company disrupt
the transportation industry and if you
keep putting everything you got into it
and you keep getting back up when you
get knocked down it's almost impossible
to fail
uber is dealing with the Justice
Department investigation into tools used
to evade law enforcement it's also
embroiled in an intellectual property
dispute over self-driving car technology
with Google's way moe in an attempt to
clean up the organization uber has fired
more than 20 employees over the past
several months the company's Board voted
on Sunday to adopt all of the changes
recommended by the independent
investigation
[Music]
